comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Thunderbird 3.1.11 / Firefox 5.0

If I import certificates which have same issuer, common name (CN) and friendly name but differ in other ways (eg. e-mail, signature), they look the same in the certificate manager window. Only viewing certificate details show the difference.
As the certificate friendly name is not the part of certificate itself (not the signed part), one can safely alter certificate friendly name. Certificate manager should allow such change and/or addition of other user-defined (or standard) attributes.
The strange thing is that if you import certificates that have no common name (CN) and share same issuer and friendly name, the certificate manager alters the certificate friendly name do make it distinct (adds rising numbers).

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Obtain more than one certificate that have same common name, issuer, etc. but do differ by e-mail (E).
2. Import those certifficates.
3. Display certificate list.

Actual Results:  
There's nothing on the list that would allow recognition of which one is which.

Expected Results:  
There should be a method to change certificate friendly name (which is shown on the certificate list) and/or other attributes and maybe a way to display additional certificate attributes on the certificate list (like e-mail attribute).

You can use TC TrustCenter free e-mail certificates (called TC Internet ID; get them from http://www.trustcenter.de/en/products/tc_internet_id.htm using "Request certificate" button) to reproduce the problem.
On the other hand, free e-mail certificates from Comodo (use "Free download" button on http://www.comodo.com/home/email-security/free-email-certificate.php), which do not have common name, show how certificate manager alters friendly name on it's own.

comments.text:
Same here on Icedove 31.6.

Instant S/MIME certificates gathered from 
https://www.instantssl.com/ssl-certificate-products/free-email-certificate.html
will have no owner CN, O, or OU attributes and be nicknamed "COMODO CA Limited ID"... after the CA's intermediate cert, with no option to change that.

Might be related to oldtimer 
https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=278689
but it's still a valid separate bug or at least a feature request to me.

This is still present in Firefox 47.0 (Windows 7).


It is /was reported many times: bug 460753 , bug 200635 (and possibly more)
At least the first bug has a good summary of what is happening in comment 4

Basically when FF asks me to select a certificate, it shows it as : (some long hexadecimal number)
while IE shows is nicely by my name: "David Balažic" (and the issuer show below it)
